hedline.hl1: National Briefing | Washington: Flimsy Bulletproof Vests

abstract.p: Justice Dept will investigate safety of bulletproof vests used by police that are made with Zylon, which appears to be deteriorating more quickly than expected; Massachusetts is suing Second Chance Body Armor, manufacturer that uses material (S)

block.p: Justice Department officials will investigate the safety of the bulletproof vests used by police officers around the country because of concerns about the reliability of the material used in many of them, Attorney General John Ashcroft announced. Law enforcement groups say they have found that Zylon, the fiber used in some vests, has deteriorated more quickly than expected. The State of Massachusetts filed a lawsuit this week against Second Chance Body Armor Inc., a Michigan manufacturer that uses the material. Toyobo, a Japanese company that manufactures Zylon, has sent the department its test data on the product and said that it welcomed the investigation.
